sample.title: Why Japan‚Äôs Economy Is at a Tipping Point
sample.description:
For 30 years, Japan‚Äôs prices were largely at a standstill. Now, a weak yen is changing everything. Here‚Äôs how consumers and businesses are coping with rising costs, and what it means for the nation‚Äôs economic future.

sample.title: Can Trump fire Fed Governor Lisa Cook?
sample.description:
The case of Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook is before the Supreme Court. Their decision will determine how much authority President Trump has over the U.S. central bank, which sets interest rates that influence the future trajectory of inflation and the job market.

Produced and Edited by: Carlos Waters
Animation: Jason Reginato, Emily Park
Senior Managing Producer: Shawn Baldwin

sample.title: Meta‚Äôs $2 Billion Bet To Win Over Enterprise Customers
sample.description:
In its latest aggressive AI move, Meta has acquired the intelligent agent firm Manus for $2 billion. The deal underscores Meta‚Äôs pursuit of enterprise dominance as the company faces mounting pressure to justify its massive AI infrastructure costs. However, the acquisition has sparked immediate backlash, with long-time Manus users retreating from the platform following the announcement. CNBC‚Äôs Julia Boorstin explores the high-stakes implications for Mark Zuckerberg as he warns investors that 2026 will see a significant surge in capital expenditures.

Produced and Edited by: Andrew Evers
Reporting by: Julia Boorstin, Stephen Desaulniers
Senior Director of Video: Jeniece Pettitt
Animation: Emily Park
Additional Footage: Getty Images

sample.title: Why Tariff Refunds Might Not Lower Prices
sample.description:
If the Supreme Court rules the tariffs are illegal, the refund process could become a lengthy back-and-forth between courts. Meanwhile, consumers are unlikely to see price drops as businesses deal with cash flow crunches. CNBC's Lori Ann LaRocco breaks down the three likeliest scenarios and why businesses will still be left waiting for their money.

Produced, Shot and Edited by: Charlotte Morabito
Reporting by: Lori Ann LaRocco
Animation: Jason Reginato, Emily Park
Addition Production Support: Isabel Iino, Andy Cedeno
Senior Director of Video: Lindsey Jacobson

sample.title: How Anthropic quietly took on OpenAI
sample.description:
Daniela and Dario Amodei left OpenAI five years ago to form Anthropic.

Anthropic‚Äôs revenue has grown 10x annually for three straight years, with 85% coming from business customers ‚Äî the inverse of OpenAI‚Äôs consumer-heavy model.

sample.title: Why Automakers Want To Power AI Data Centers
sample.description:
With EV sales faltering and forecasts lowered, automakers are looking for ways to sell the batteries they are making. CNBC's Robert Ferris breaks down how and why automakers including General Motors and Ford are investing in a new industry.

Producer: Robert Ferris
Editor: Natalie Rice
Animation: Jason Reginato
Senior Managing Producer: Tala Hadavi
Additional footage:Ford, Getty Images, GM, Redwood Materials, Tesla
Additional sources: Benchmark Mineral Intelligence, Carnegie Mellon University, Wood Mackenzie

sample.title: Trump: We have a 'concept of a deal' for Greenland
sample.description:
President Donald Trump on Wednesday said he and NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte have ‚Äúformed the framework of a future deal with respect to Greenland.‚Äù In an interview with CNBC, Trump described the Greenland framework as the ‚Äúconcept of a deal.‚Äù

Trump said that as a result of that negotiation, he would no longer impose punitive tariffs on a slew of European countries that were set to begin Feb. 1.

sample.title: Trump says he could have renovated Fed HQ for $25 million
sample.description:
President Donald Trump, in an interview Wednesday with CNBC, blasted Fed Chair Jerome Powell for his oversight of a $2.5 billion project to renovate the Federal Reserve's headquarters complex in Washington, D.C. The Fed chair last week said that he was under federal criminal investigation in connection with his oversight of the project.

‚ÄúI could have redone it. I could have fixed it for 25 million bucks. It would have looked beautiful,‚Äù the president said.

sample.title: Donald Trump says he 'won't use force' to acquire Greenland | BBC Newscast
sample.description:
Today, US President Donald Trump addressed the World Economic Forum at Davos to confirm he wants "immediate negotiations" to acquire Greenland but "won‚Äôt use force".  

Adam is joined by Faisal Islam, who was in the room watching Trump speak, and Caitriona Perry in Washington to decode President Trump‚Äôs wide-ranging speech.

sample.title: Do heat pumps make your bills cheaper? #UK #Energy #HeatPump #GreenTech #BBCNews
What is Trump's Board of Peace? | Global News Podcast
sample.description:
When the White House announced the creation of a new international body, it was framed as part of the Gaza peace plan. 

But US President Donald Trump appears to have much more wide-reaching ambitions for his Board of Peace. A leaked draft of the charter suggests it will have a broader purpose of resolving global conflicts. 

Many countries and world leaders have been invited to join, including China and Russia.

Is this a new international body designed to challenge or replace the United Nations? And what power would it have?
 
Subscribe to the Global News Podcast wherever you get your podcasts or find more episodes here: https://bbc.in/GlobalNewsPodcast

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews

sample.title: Donald Trump drops threat of tariffs over Greenland after Nato talks in Davos | BBC News
sample.description:
US President Donald Trump has said he is dropping plans to add a 10% tariff to goods from eight European countries over their opposition to his push to acquire Greenland.
 
In a post on social media Trump said he has "formed the framework of a future deal with respect to Greenland" after talks with Nato's secretary general.
 
Earlier, the president ruled out using force to take over Greenland - but said he was seeking "immediate negations" to acquire the island.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#DonaldTrump #Greenland #BBCNews
